Polish ambassador gives reception 
    Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Wojciech Kaluja, Polish ambassador to the DPRK, yesterday hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Club for the diplomatic corps on the occasion of the Independence Day of Poland.
 Invited to the reception were Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of foreign affairs, officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and embassy officials.   
 At the reception speeches were made.

U.S. forces S. Korea to pay more for military exercises 
    Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that the U.S. imperialists had demanded the South Korean authorities cover expenses for military exercises from 1994, according to Yonhap News from Seoul.
 Beside the fund for the upkeep of the U.S. troops, the U.S. imperialists had forced the South Korean authorities to cover expenses for the three joint military exercises including the "reception, staging, onward movement and integration exercise" and "Ulji-Focus Lens" exercise from 1997 to last year, the total amount of which reached more than 8.5 million U.S. dollars.    
 This year they demanded the south korean authorities pay more for exercises than last year. All these funds are reportedly used mainly for the transport of U.S. military equipment in South Korea and the payment to U.S. technical personnel.
